contentrichtext.text: '''Khalid Hassanali''', son of former [[President]] of [[Trinidad and Tobago]], [[Noor Hassanali]],<ref>[http://www.nalis.gov.tt/Biography/bio_NoorHassanali.html Noor Hassanali], Biographical Summary of the Former President of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, from NALIS, the National Library and Information Service {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5v255zkVd|date =2010-12-16}}</ref> is a Vice-President for Corporate Administrative Services at [[Petrotrin]],<ref name = eTecK>[http://www.eteck.co.tt/applicationloader.asp?app=articles&id=761 Management Team], Evolving TecKnologies and Enterprise Development Company Limited {{dead link|date=December 2010}}</ref> the Petroleum Company of Trinidad and Tobago (a state-owned oil company). He is currently on secondment (assignment) as President/CEO of Evolving TecKnologies and Enterprise Development Company of Trinidad and Tobago (eTecK),<ref name = eTecK/><ref>[http://www.tradeind.gov.tt/agen_bodies/ag_bds.htm State Agencies], Ministry of Trade and Industry, Government of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago {{dead link|date=December 2010}}</ref> another state-owned venture that is responsible for the industrial development of the non-energy sector of Trinidad and Tobago. He also serves as Chairman of the Board of the [[Telecommunications Authority of Trinidad and Tobago]].<ref>[http://www.tatt.org.tt/board.htm Board], [[Telecommunications Authority of Trinidad and Tobago]] {{dead link|date=December 2010}}</ref> Hassanali is also a member of the board of the following: the National Institute of Higher Education, Research, Science and Technology (NIHERST),<ref>[http://www.niherst.gov.tt/aboutus/bog.htm Board of Governors], NIHERST {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5v259Vnty|date =2010-12-16}}</ref> the Point Lisas Industrial Port Development Co (PLIPDECO), Metal Industries Company (MIC)and ANSA McAL Chemicals Ltd. He is a former 1st Vice President of the South Trinidad Chamber of Industry and Commerce. Hassanali has a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from the [[University of the West Indies]], a Master of Science in Systems Planning and Optimisation from the [[University of London]] and a Bachelor of Laws from the University of London.<ref name = eTecK/> He completed his secondary schooling at [[Queen's Royal College]] in [[Port of Spain]]. He has three children, Behzad, Faria Hassanali-Badaloo, and Aadam.<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.maravalinc.com/angela/hassanalis_50th.htm | title = Hassanalis 50th Anniversary| accessdate = 2007-05-15| last = Pidduck| first = Angela| authorlink = Angela Pidduck| date = | year = 2002| month = | publisher = | quote = |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5v25NyJI0 |archivedate = 2010-12-16|deadurl=no}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hassanali, Khalid | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hassanali, Khalid}} [[Category:Trinidad and Tobago businesspeople]] [[Category:Trinidad and Tobago people of Indian descent]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of the West Indies alumni]] {{business-bio-stub}} {{Trinidad-bio-stub}}
